table.name: mem
table.column: The resemblance to Tasha Yar's name is a coincidence, as the first edition of {TKD:src} came out before {TNG:src} aired.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers both to the brain and to "mind, intellect". For the organ, see {QoghIj:n}.
▶ {targhlIj yab tIn law' no'lI' Hoch yabDu' tIn puS!:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column: This is no Klingon word for "cuddle", but {yachchuq:v@@yach:v:1, -chuq:v} gets the idea across.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word does not appear in canon by itself, but can be inferred from {jIb yachwI':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
Klingon has five verbs corresponding to each of the {yaD:n:1,nolink}: {mar:v}, {Hom:v}, {roS:v:2}, {nan:v:2}, and {Qay':v:2}.
Correspondingly, the five toes are {marwI':n}, {HomwI':n}, {roSwI':n}, {nanwI':n:2}, and {Qay'wI':n}.
The toe verbs are used in the same way as the finger verbs, but they are not heard often outside of discussions about martial arts movements or dance, and are normally considered archaic.
The verbs for the toes come from the nursery rhyme "This Little Piggy".

table.name: mem
table.column: This slang word originated from the similarity of {yan:n} and {yaD:n:1} in the {Qotmagh Sep:n} dialect.

table.name: mem
table.column: A planet in the Gamma Quadrant, a part of the Dominion.
Ein Planet im Gamma-Quadranten, ein Teil des Dominion. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
سیاره ای در چهار گوش گاما ، بخشی از Dominion. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
En planet i Gamma Quadrant, en del av Dominion. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
伽瑪象限中的一顆行星，是自治領的一部分。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Um planeta no Quadrante Gama, uma parte do Domínio. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word does not seem to have appeared in canon, but it is obvious by analogy with {nItlhpach:n:1}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This refers to any place where one does work, and isn't limited to military usage.[2]
Any place specifically designated for the performance of a specific task or tasks is a {yaH:n:nolink}. For example, a stage is the {yaH:n:nolink} for the performance of plays or music, a football field is the {yaH:n:nolink} for a football game, a laboratory ({Qulpa':n}) is a scientist's {yaH:n:nolink}. If context isn't enough to clarify what sort of {yaH:n:nolink} one is referring to, one can say things like {much yaH:n}, {QoQ yaH:n@@QoQ:n, yaH:n}, {tamlerQeD yaH:n@@tamlerQeD:n, yaH:n}, and so on.[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is in clipped Klingon. In standard Klingon, "Do you understand?" (speaking to one person) would be {bIyaj'a'?:sen:nolink}

table.name: mem
table.column: This might be said in response to {yaj'a'?:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a line such as on lined paper, or painted on the road.
Dies beschreibt eine Linie auf liniertem Papier, oder einen Strich auf einer Fahrbahn.
این به خطی از قبیل کاغذهای روکش دار یا نقاشی شده در جاده اشاره دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta avser en linje som på fodrat papper eller målad på vägen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к линии, например, на линованной бумаге или нарисованной на дороге. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這指的是一條線，例如在橫格紙上或塗在道路上的線。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Refere-se a uma linha como papel forrado ou pintado na estrada. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
"What's My Line" ({watmay:sen:nolink}) was a TV show.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is a weapon with long blades.
This word is also used as slang for a "bow" which is used to play the {ngItHel:n}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: The members of the {yan 'ISletlh:n:nolink} are the Chancellor's personal bodyguards.
The Yan-Isleth was mentioned in {DS9 - Apocalypse Rising:src}. It appears in the glossary to the novel {A Burning House:src} spelled as {yanISletlh:sen:nolink}.
▶ {Qang QanmeH yan 'ISletlh Damuv 'e' wIvlu'.:sen:nolink} "You are chosen to serve on the Yan-Isleth and protect the Chancellor."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: According to {KGT p.79:src}, {raQ:v} can be used as a substitute for {yan:v:nolink} in the context of swords.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is defined in the body of {KGT:src} on p.61.

table.name: mem
table.column: The Chinese term for bird's nest as a food item is "yànwō" (燕窝).

table.name: mem
table.column: The Chinese word for stamp (印) is "yìn". Negative images are like "yīn" and "yáng" (陰陽).

table.name: mem
table.column:
There are nine ranks ({patlh:n}) of officers[2]: ▶ {'aj:n} "admiral" ▶ {Sa':n} "general" ▶ {totlh:n} "commodore" ▶ {'ech:n} "brigadier" ▶ {HoD:n} "captain" ▶ {la':n} "commander" ▶ {Sogh:n} "lieutenant" ▶ {lagh:n} "ensign" ▶ {ne':n} "yeoman"
The highest military officer, the head of the {ra'ghomquv:n}, is the {la'quv:n}. Someone of rank {Sogh:n} or higher can also be referred to as {ra'wI':n}. The special title {la''a':n} is used for officers in charge of certain specialized units within the military, regardless of their official ranks.

table.name: mem
table.column: می تواند به عنوان عنوان استفاده شود [AUTOTRANSLATED]
может быть использован в качестве заголовка [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: می تواند به عنوان عنوان استفاده شود [AUTOTRANSLATED]
может быть использован в качестве заголовка [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a gray (sometimes white) bird that can travel particularly long distances without pausing.
Dies ist ein grauer (manchmal weißer) Vogel, der besonders lange Strecken ohne Pause zurücklegen kann. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این یک پرنده خاکستری (گاهی سفید) است که می تواند مسافت های خاص را بدون مکث طی کند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är en grå (ibland vit) fågel som kan resa särskilt långa sträckor utan att pausa. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это серая (иногда белая) птица, которая может путешествовать особенно на большие расстояния без остановки. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是一隻灰色（有時是白色）的鳥，可以不停地走很長的距離。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é um pássaro cinzento (às vezes branco) que pode viajar longas distâncias sem fazer uma pausa. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
"Yacht Cup". The Swallow is a type of keelboat.

table.name: mem
table.column: A pregnant woman is said to {qeng:v} a {puq:n}.[2]

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: پیروزی باید به دست آورده شود [AUTOTRANSLATED]
勝利是必須要贏返來的。

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the common way to say this.
Dies ist die übliche Art, dies zu sagen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این روش متداول برای گفتن این است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är det vanliga sättet att säga detta. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta é a maneira comum de dizer isso. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: relação de vitória, frequência das vitórias

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the "picture" which results from doodling if it is not easily identifiable or nameable.
Dies bezieht sich auf das "Bild", das sich aus Kritzeleien ergibt, wenn es nicht leicht zu identifizieren oder zu benennen ist. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این به "تصویر" مربوط می شود که اگر به راحتی قابل شناسایی یا نامگذاری نباشد ، از doodling نتیجه می گیرد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta hänvisar till "bilden" som härrör från doodling om den inte är lätt identifierbar eller namngiven. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к «картинке», которая возникает в результате рисования, если ее трудно идентифицировать или назвать. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指“圖片”，如果不容易識別或命名，則是由於塗鴉而產生的。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso se refere à "imagem" resultante de rabiscos, se não for facilmente identificável ou nomeada. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This word wasn't given an English definition but was described, along with the example "just circles or squiggles or jagged lines or a mishmash of things".
Maltz thought there must have been, historically, a connection between this word and {yay:n:2}, but wasn't sure.
"Win, Lose or Draw" is the name of a TV game show.

table.name: mem
table.column: vara chockad, vara mållös, vara förstummad

table.name: mem
table.column: The Toyota Yaris was also sold under the name Toyota Echo.

table.name: mem
table.column: مچ دست (همچنین یک اصطلاح عامیانه از تخلیه) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is also a slang term of deprecation ({yeb:n:2}).
This is listed in the {KGT:src} word lists as "wrist (also a slang term of deprecation)". The two meanings have been split into separate entries for consistency with other slang terms.

table.name: mem
table.column: This slang meaning was influenced by the Krotmag pronunciation of {yeb:n:1}, which sounds like {yem:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is an organization dedicated to scholastic pursuits or research. The distinction between {yejHaD:n:nolink} and {yej'an:n} is not clear, but {yejHaD:n:nolink} is usually used for larger organizations. It's not known whether the first syllable is the word {yej:n}, but there could be some historic connection.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is an organization dedicated to scholastic pursuits or research. The distinction between {yej'an:n:nolink} and {yejHaD:n} is not clear, but {yejHaD:n:nolink} is usually used for larger organizations. It's not known whether the first syllable is the word {yej:n}, but there could be some historic connection.[1]
Do not confuse this with a society in the cultural sense, for which see {nugh:n}.[1]
▶ {tlhIngan yej'an:n:nolink} would be "a group dedicated to the study of Klingons"[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: The subject is the cooperating parties.
O assunto são as partes que colaboraram. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is missing from the K-E side of {TKD:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is used in {Klingon Monopoly:src} to denote a game square, including those corresponding to the four ship classes.
▶ {nom yer mechmeH Quj} "The Fast-Dealing Property Trading Game"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that Klingons consider title deeds to be a type of {chaw':n}, rather than a type of {Qoyje':n}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: A reference to the walls of "Jericho".

table.name: mem
table.column: ضروری است: شما - هیچ، شما - او / او / آن، شما (جمع) - او / او / آن [AUTOTRANSLATED]

{SoH:n}:{pagh:n:1h} = {yI-:v:pref,nolink} (imp.) {SoH:n}:{ghaH:n}/{'oH:n} = {yI-:v:pref,nolink} (imp.) {tlhIH:n}:{ghaH:n}/{'oH:n} = {yI-:v:pref,nolink} (imp.)
If the command is given to multiple people and the object is none, be careful to use {pe-:v} instead.
Generally, when a verb describing a state of being is used as an imperative, the suffixes {-'egh:v} and {-moH:v} are used with it.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is one of the example Klingon phrases on the KLI web site.

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {'up; yIH rur@@'up:v, yIH:n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: او را روی صفحه قرار دهید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This can also mean "Put her on screen" or "Put it on screen". A shorter way of putting it in English is just "On screen". However, "Put them on screen" would be {tIHotlh.:sen:nolink}

table.name: mem
table.column: ساکت باش! (به عنوان مثال، صحبت نکنید!) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This was used as the refrain of a song in {TNG - Birthright, Part I:src}. The actors mispronounced it so badly that it was retrofitted by the fan community and performed by the Indianapolis "il Troubadore" as {yIjaH Qey' 'oH:sen:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The English translation given on {TKD p.170:src} is "Feed him!", but this also means "Feed her!" or "Feed it!"

table.name: mem
table.column: جشن گرفتن! فردا ما ممکن است بمیریم [AUTOTRANSLATED]
慶祝！明天我們可能會死！ [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
mem
table.column:
This word can be used transitively to say things like {tlhIngan yIn DayIn:sen:nolink} "You live a Klingon life."[2]
To say that someone "lives at" a place, use {Dab:v}.

The Klingon sentence {tlhIngan yIn DayIn:sen:nolink} was written by MO in someone's {KGT:src} when he autographed it. It does not actually appear in the {HQ 7.4:src} article, but it is alluded to there by its English translation.

table.name: mem
table.column: Um das Leben zu verstehen, ertrage den Schmerz.
Para entender a vida, suporte a dor.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a common Vulcan saying.
Dies ist ein allgemeines vulkanisches Sprichwort. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این یک جمله رایج ولکان است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é um ditado vulcano comum. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This translation also appeared in the Klingon subtitles for {DSC - The Vulcan Hello:src}.
An earlier translation of this phrase appears in UPN's Star Trek 25th Anniversary Special (1991), spoken by Leonard Nimoy (not in character as Spock): {yItaH 'ej yIcheptaH@@yI-:v, taH:v:1, 'ej:conj, yI-:v, chep:v, -taH:v}.
[1] {Radio Times Star Trek 30th Anniversary Special Issue:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: این به معنای واقعی کلمه به معنای "گاز حیات" است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這字面意思是“生命之氣”。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Siehe wie Gowron dies sagt: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/sKHEvMGdaxE}

table.name: mem
table.column: yIntaHbogh qagh jablu'DI' reH nIvqu' qagh.
Gagh is always best when served live.
Gagh ist immer am besten, wenn es lebend serviert wird.
گاگ همیشه بهترین زمانی است که در خدمت زنده است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Gagh är alltid bäst när det serveras live. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Gagh is always best when served live. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Gagh在現場直播時總是最好的。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Gagh é sempre melhor quando servido ao vivo.

table.name: mem
table.column: There will be no peace as long as Kirk lives.
Solange Kirk fortbesteht ist Frieden nicht möglich.
تا زمانی که کرک زنده بماند هیچ صلحی وجود نخواهد داشت. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Det kommer ingen fred så länge som Kirk lever. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Там не будет мира, пока Кирк живет. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
只要柯克生活，就不會有和平。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Não haverá paz enquanto Kirk viver.
[1] {Star Trek V deleted scene:src}, [2] {HQ 8.4, p.12, Dec. 1999:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: This was used by MO in a "get well" letter to Glen Proechel in March of 1998. According to the rule given in {KGT:src}, this should've been {yIpIv'eghmoH!:sen@@yI-:v, pIv:v, -'egh:v, -moH:v} See under {taD:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is missing from the E-K side of {TKD:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Don't just aim; hit the target!
Ziele nicht nur; treffe das Ziel!
فقط هدف را ندارید به هدف زدن! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Don't just aim; hit the target! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
不要只是瞄準，要擊中目標！
Não apenas mire; atinja o alvo!

table.name: mem
table.column: For example, used to describe a warrior gathering his armour and weapons before a battle.
Wird beispielsweise verwendet, um einen Krieger zu beschreiben, der vor einer Schlacht seine Rüstungen und Waffen sammelt. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
به عنوان مثال ، برای توصیف یک جنگجو که قبل از نبرد ، زره و سلاح خود را جمع می کرد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Till exempel används för att beskriva en krigare som samlade sina rustningar och vapen före en strid. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Например, используется для описания воина, собирающего свою броню и оружие перед битвой. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
例如，用來形容戰士在戰鬥前收集盔甲和武器的戰士。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Por exemplo, costumava descrever um guerreiro reunindo suas armaduras e armas antes de uma batalha. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
▶ {nuHmeyDaj may'luchDaj nIv je yIr qeylIS:sen:nolink} "Kahless gathered his weapons and his finest suit of armor"

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is used when addressing a single person. To address multiple people, say {peratlh!:sen@@pe-:v, ratlh:v}
Watch Gowron say this: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/HVOJkR51lBU}

table.name: mem
table.column: This is misspelled as "Yiridian" in both word lists in {KGT:src}, but it is consistently spelled "Yridian" elsewhere, including {TKW:src} as well as Star Trek canon.

table.name: mem
table.column: Stand by to de-cloak for firing.
Sei bereit zum Enttarnen. Sei bereit zum Feuern.
برای جلوگیری از شلیک کردن، به پای خود بایستید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Stå av för att skydda för att skjuta. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Stand by to de-cloak for firing. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: ساکت باش! (به عنوان مثال، آرام باش!) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Siehe wie Gowron dies sagt: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/PUwSJai1cps}

table.name: mem
table.column: be strict, severe, firm, stern, authoritarian
سختگیرانه، شدید، قوی، سخت، اقتدارگرا باشد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara sträng, svår, fast, sträng, auktoritär [AUTOTRANSLATED]
be strict, severe, firm, stern, authoritarian [AUTOTRANSLATED]
嚴謹、嚴厲、堅定、嚴厲、專制 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser rígido, severo, firme, austero, autoritário

table.name: mem
table.column: The subject of this verb can only be a person or creature, not an inanimate object or situation. See {KGT p.167:src} for an explanation of this slang word.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word originally referred to a sleeveless garment (see {yIvbeH:n:2}).
In {TNK:src}, this word is used to translate "shirt", and {yIvbeH SeQHa':n:nolink} is used for "T-shirt".

table.name: mem
table.column: This word has this meaning in the {voSpegh Sep:n} dialect.

table.name: mem
table.column: Habe vertrauen, aber achte auf die Türen.
اعتماد کنید، اما درهای را پیدا کنید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
There is a grammatical error with this sentence. It should be {tISam:sen@@tI-:v, Sam:v} rather than {yISam:sen:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Vertrauen ist gut, Kontrolle ist besser.

table.name: mem
table.column: speak in an honorable or respectful fashion
in ehrvoller und respektvoller Weise sprechen
با مدرک یا احترام صحبت کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
tala på ett hedervärt eller respektfullt sätt [AUTOTRANSLATED]
以尊重或尊重的方式說話 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
falar de uma maneira honrosa ou respeitosa
The example sentence appears to be a lip-match for {HIja':excl}.
speak in an honourable or respectful fashion

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is used for gathering plants or plant parts, whether {Du' naH:n} or {naH tlhab:n}. (See {KGT p.89:src}.)

table.name: mem
table.column: According to {A Burning House:src}, this is a Klingon festival to celebrate the end of harvest. Its name literally comes from {yob:v} and {-ta':v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to a plate of material, often metal, carried by a warrior for protection. It is not used to refer to the force fields ({Surchem:n}) protecting a spaceship, for which see {botjan:n}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used for real (physical) shields. To "shield oneself" is {yoD'egh}. For force fields, use {botjan:n} with {chu':v:2}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Reverse of {jImoy:sen:nolink} "Jimmy", a reference to the character Jimmy Neutron.

table.name: mem
table.column: The English translation of the sentence from {Star Trek Constellations:src} does not appear in the book, but in the author's annotations which was a separate document.
▶ {qab yon Da'agh. qablIj yon yI'aghHa' 'aghHa'pa' 'etlhwIj.:sen:nolink} "Scrape that smug look from your face before my blade does it for you."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {yIyong 'ej pa' yIQam.:sen@@yI-:v, yong:v, 'ej:conj, pa':n:2, yI-:v, Qam:v} "Get in and stand there!"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {tlhIngan wo' yuQmey chovlu'chugh Qo'noS potlh law' Hoch potlh puS. roD 'oHvaD juHqo' ponglu' neH. pa' 'oHtaH vaS'a''e'. tlhIngan qum waw' 'oH. yoq yIn yuQ 'oH Qo'noS'e'. yInSIp voQSIp je ngaS muDDaj.:sen:nolink} "The principal planet of the Klingon Empire, Qo'noS is usually referred to as simply "The Homeworld." This is where the Klingon Great Hall is located, the center of the Klingon government. Qo'noS is a class-M planet with an oxygen/nitrogen atmosphere."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is not used for a removable top, which would be a {yuvtlhe':n} "lid". The other face of an object's {yor:n:nolink} is called its {'aqroS:n:1}.[1]
"You're the Top" is a song by Cole Porter.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the general term for a fixed or non-fixed shelf.
Dies ist der allgemeine Begriff für ein festes oder nicht festes Regal. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این اصطلاح عمومی برای یک قفسه ثابت یا غیر ثابت است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är den allmänna termen för en fast eller icke-fast hylla. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это общий термин для фиксированной или нефиксированной полки. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是固定或非固定架子的總稱。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é o termo geral para uma prateleira fixa ou não fixa. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: This word is listed among other militaristic terminology in the body of {KGT:src} on p.48.

table.name: mem
table.column: This line was spoken in Klingon but was not subtitled.
Diese Zeile wurde auf Klingonisch gesprochen, aber nicht mit Untertiteln versehen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این خط در کلینگون صحبت شد اما زیرنویس نبود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Denna rad talades i Klingon men undertecknades inte. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Эта строка говорилась на клингонском языке, но не имела субтитров. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
此行在克林崗語中被使用，但沒有字幕。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta linha foi falada em klingon, mas não foi legendada. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is listed among other militaristic terminology in the body of {KGT:src} on p.48.

table.name: mem
table.column: This was defined only as "field (of land)" in {TKD:src}. The definition "park (e.g., recreational)" was added at the {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2016:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: vänd upp och ner, vänd invertera [AUTOTRANSLATED]
virar de cabeça para baixo, virar, inverter

This can be used to mean "flip (all the way) over" (i.e., flip something else over). If something is just tipped over but not flipped over, see {qaw'moH:v}. If something flipped all the way over on its own accord or seemingly on its own accord, the verb to use would be {tach:v}.[2]

The verb {yoy:v} does not appear with the suffix {-moH:v} in canon. However, MO approved of {yoymoHwI'} as a bit of technobabble meaning "inverter".[1] Subsequently, MO approved of the gloss "turn upside down, flip, invert".[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: A fleet consists of more than one {nawlogh:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This term refers to a concept which appears in Klingon beliefs about the afterlife.
Dieser Begriff bezieht sich auf ein Konzept, das in klingonischen Überzeugungen über das Leben nach dem Tod vorkommt. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این اصطلاح به مفهومی اطلاق می شود که در عقاید کلینگون درباره زندگی پس از زندگی ظاهر می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Denna term hänvisar till ett begrepp som visas i Klingons övertygelser om livet efter livet. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Этот термин относится к концепции, которая появляется в верованиях клингонов о загробной жизни. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這個術語是指在克林崗人關於來世的信仰中出現的一個概念。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este termo refere-se a um conceito que aparece nas crenças de Klingon sobre a vida após a morte. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: The sentence in which this appeared was actually written with hyphens, like this: {HoD, yo'-SeH yaH-nIv-vo' potlh De' wI-Hev-taH:sen:nolink}, with a newline between {potlh:sen:nolink} and {De':sen:nolink}.[1] The correct spelling (and spacing) was later confirmed.[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: We are receiving a priority message from Operations Command.
Wir haben wichtige Daten vom Operationskommando empfangen.
ما پیام اولویتی از فرمان عملیات دریافت می کنیم. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Vi får ett prioriterat meddelande från Operations Command. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Мы получаем приоритетное сообщение от Оперативного командования. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
我們正在接收來自Operations Command的優先消息。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Estamos recebendo uma mensagem prioritária do Comando de Operações.

This line was cut from {Star Trek V:src}. The sentence in which this appeared was actually written with hyphens, like this: {HoD, yo'-SeH yaH-nIv-vo' potlh De' wI-Hev-taH:sen:nolink}, with a newline between {potlh:sen:nolink} and {De':sen:nolink}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: first (and last) tone of nonatonic musical scale
erster (und letzter) Ton der neunstufigen Tonleiter
اولین (و آخرین) تن از مقیاس موسیقی غیرتتونونی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
första (och sista) tonen på den nonatoniska skalan
первый (и последний) тон неатонической музыкальной гаммы [AUTOTRANSLATED]
非音階音階的第一個（也是最後一個）音調 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
primeiro (e último) tom da escala musical não-atônica

The tones of the Klingon musical scale are: {yu:n:nolink}, {bIm:n}, {'egh:n}, {loS:n:2}, {vagh:n:2}, {jav:n:2}, {Soch:n:2}, {chorgh:n:2}, {yu:n:nolink}.[1]
The first and second {yu:n:nolink} are not an octave apart, but rather a nonave apart.[2]
Instead of "doe", which is a deer, an "ewe" is a sheep.

table.name: mem
table.column: husk, rind, peel, shell (of fruit, nut)
پوست، پوست، پوست، پوست (از میوه، مهره) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
稻殼、果皮、果皮、殼（水果、堅果） [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Humans eat {yuch ngoghmey:n:nolink}, which Maltz finds strange.
▶ {nuqDaq yuch Dapol?:sen:nolink} "Where do you keep the chocolate?"[1, p.172; 2]

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {yuD; jey'naS rur@@yuD:v, jey'naS:n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {yuDHa'; ghIt rur@@yuDHa':v, ghIt:n:0, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: include, consist of, be composed of
include, consist of, be composed of [AUTOTRANSLATED]
incluir, consistir em, ser composto de
This is used for talking about chemistry.
Dies wird verwendet, um über Chemie zu sprechen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این برای صحبت در مورد شیمی استفاده می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta används för att prata om kemi. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это используется для разговоров о химии. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso é usado para falar sobre química. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

▶ {cha' bIQSIp HeySelmey, wa' yInSIp HeySel je yugh bIQ 'o'rIS@@cha':n, bIQSIp:n, HeySel:n, -mey:n, wa':n, yInSIp:n, HeySel:n, je:conj, yugh:v, bIQ:n, 'o'rIS:n} "the water molecule consists of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom"

table.name: mem
table.column: filter for X only, include X only
فیلتر تنها برای X، شامل X فقط [AUTOTRANSLATED]
filtrera endast för X, inkludera endast X [AUTOTRANSLATED]
фильтр только для X, включая только X [AUTOTRANSLATED]
filtro apenas para X, incluir apenas X

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a play by {wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name}, and also the name of its titular character.

table.name: mem
table.column: levar a melhor em, superar (em esperteza, inteligência)

table.name: mem
table.column: Förenade planeters federation (United Federation of Planets)
The United Federation of Planets is often simply called "the Federation" ({DIvI':n}). Another word for it is {yuQjIjQa':n:nolink}.
This is missing from the K-E side of {TKD:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Förenade planeters federation (United Federation of Planets)
Another word for the United Federation of Planets is {yuQjIjDIvI':n:nolink} (often shortened to just {DIvI':n}).
This is missing from the E-K side of {TKD:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: 分散注意力、創造一種轉移 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The object of this verb (when there is one) is the person or group of people (usually) being distracted.
Das Objekt dieses Verbs (wenn es eines gibt) ist die Person oder Gruppe von Personen, die (normalerweise) abgelenkt wird. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
هدف این فعل (وقتی وجود دارد) این است که شخص یا گروهی از افراد (معمولاً) پریشان شوند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Syftet med detta verb (när det finns en) är personen eller gruppen människor (vanligtvis) som distraheras. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Объект этого глагола (когда он есть) - это человек или группа людей (обычно) отвлекающихся. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這個動詞的對象（如果有）是分散注意力的一個人或一群人。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
O objeto desse verbo (quando existe um) é a pessoa ou grupo de pessoas (geralmente) que está sendo distraído. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is the word for a musical scale, but it can also be used for other sorts of ranges.
The tones of the Klingon musical scale are: {yu:n:nolink}, {bIm:n}, {'egh:n}, {loS:n:2}, {vagh:n:2}, {jav:n:2}, {Soch:n:2}, {chorgh:n:2}, {yu:n:nolink}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: پسر عموی دور یا برادرزاده / خواهرزاده [AUTOTRANSLATED]
kusinbarn, tremänning, avlägset syskonbarn (syskons barnbarn, syssling etc.)

The singular form is never used in place of {tey':n:nolink} or {lor:n:nolink}, but the plural may be used for a group including {tey':n:nolink} and/or {lor:n:nolink}, so long as there is at least one more distant cousin, niece or nephew in the group.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a chemical compound which reacts to create an explosion when combined with {'anISyum:n}.
[1] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2017:src}, [2] {DSC - Magic to Make the Sanest Man Go Mad:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a reference to the merger between United Airlines (UA) and Continental Airlines.

table.name: mem
table.column: lock, kapsyl, propp, kork, överdrag, fodral
Literally, "push, turn" (how you open a so-called child-proof lid).

table.name: mem
table.column: It may just be a coincidence, but {yu:n} and {'egh:n} are the first and third tones of the Klingon nonatonic musical scale.
This is missing from the E-K side of {TKD:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
There is no difference between a paper form or a digital form on a computer screen.
The verb {naQmoH:v@@naQ:v, -moH:v} is used for filling out forms.
